repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Water Supply and
            Sanitation Sector Adjustment Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Water Supply and
            Sanitation Sector Adjustment Program for Cote d'Ivoire
            was satisfactory. The project achieved most of its
            objectives, its impact on institutional development was
            substantial, sustainability is uncertain, and the
            performance of both the Bank and Borrower was satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First, the
            effectiveness of a sectoral adjustment program is better
            warranted whenever policy changes take place sufficiently in
            advance of loan approval. Second, the association of a SECAL
            and an ongoing investment loan is a practical alternative to
            an hybrid loan. Third, the Ivorian experience of
            privatization of urban water services confirms that the
            private sector is not interested in purchasing existing
            water facilities or financing investments from its own
            resources. Fourth, centralized maintenance of scattered
            rural facilities is not sustainable, even if it is carried
            out by a private company. Fifth, the fragmentation of
            investment-related responsibilities led to an overall lack
            of accountability. Finally, sectoral investment funds backed
            by earmarked resources are vulnerable.

repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Water Supply and
            Sanitation Sector Adjustment Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Water Supply and Sanitation Sector
            Adjustment Loan (WASAL) supports the Government's
            comprehensive program of reforms in the water supply and
            sanitation sector.  The main objectives of this program are
            : a) to restore the availability of basic rural services; b)
            to improve planning and sustainability of investments; c) to
            improve control of costs and efficiency of pricing; d) to
            strengthen the protection of water resources and of the
            environment; and e) to restore the financial autonomy of the
            sector. To this effect, the program comprises the following
            : 1) a new institutional framework based on Government
            retrenchment through increased privatization and community
            management of rural facilities; 2) introduction of efficient
            pricing of urban water services and of full recovery of
            maintenance costs in rural areas; 3) establishment of
            regulations and controls on private extraction of
            groundwater and on disposal of domestic and industrial
            wastewater; and 4) implementation of a new financing
            strategy and restructuring of sector finances.
